nodes.bodyText: Should we mark ProtobufRpcEngine class as deprecated?
Should we mark this class as deprecated?
apache/ozone#987 is now available. If the PR is merged, I think we don't have to fix DFSUtil.java.
But, I feel, we can still keep the method with deprecated.

The profile is not activated on Mac and compile fails.

        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      <family>linux</family>
          
          
            
                      <arch>amd64</arch>
          
          
            
                      <arch>!aarch64</arch>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1015,7 +1031,81 @@
         </plugins>
       </build>
     </profile>
-
+    <!-- profile to use already generated protobuf code using 2.5.0 for aarch64-->
+    <profile>
+      <id>aarch64</id>
+      <activation>
+        <activeByDefault>false</activeByDefault>
+        <os>
+          <family>linux</family>
+          <arch>aarch64</arch>
+        </os>
+      </activation>
+      <build>
+        <plugins>
+          <plugin>
+            <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
+            <artifactId>build-helper-maven-plugin</artifactId>
+            <executions>
+              <execution>
+                <id>add-source-legacy-protobuf</id>
+                <phase>generate-sources</phase>
+                <goals>
+                  <goal>add-source</goal>
+                </goals>
+                <configuration>
+                  <sources>
+                    <source>${basedir}/src/main/arm-java</source>
+                  </sources>
+                </configuration>
+              </execution>
+            </executions>
+          </plugin>
+        </plugins>
+      </build>
+    </profile>
+    <!-- profile to generate protobuf code using 2.5.0-->
+    <profile>
+      <id>x86_64</id>
+      <activation>
+        <activeByDefault>false</activeByDefault>
+        <os>
+          <family>linux</family>
+          <arch>amd64</arch>

nodes.bodyText: Big +1 for this change, but I think this issue can be fixed in a separate jira.

Pushed the latest changes without this.
Please check
